places.name: Ibirapuera Park
places.address: Av. Pedro Álvares Cabral - Vila Mariana, São Paulo
places.description: A vast urban park featuring lakes, gardens, and walking trails. Ideal for outdoor activities, cultural events, and visiting museums located inside the park, offering a peaceful escape in the city.

places.name: Catavento Museum
places.address: Praça Cívica Ulisses Guimarães, 1 - Centro, São Paulo
places.description: Interactive science museum offering exhibits on physics, biology, and technology. Visitors can engage with hands-on experiments and educational activities suitable for children and adults, making learning enjoyable and memorable.

places.name: Roda Rico
places.address: Av. Manuel Bandeira - Jaguaré, São Paulo
places.description: Observation wheel standing 91 meters tall, providing panoramic views of São Paulo. Located in Parque Cândido Portinari, it is perfect for photography, sightseeing, and enjoying the city from a unique perspective.

places.name: Museum of Contemporary Art (MAC-USP)
places.address: Av. Pedro Álvares Cabral, 1301 - Ibirapuera, São Paulo
places.description: One of Brazil's most prominent contemporary art museums, featuring works by Brazilian and international artists. The collection includes paintings, sculptures, and installations, showcasing creativity and innovation.

places.name: São Paulo Botanical Garden
places.address: Av. Miguel Stéfano, 3031 - Água Funda, São Paulo
places.description: A serene botanical garden with diverse plant species, walking trails, and well-kept landscapes. Perfect for nature walks, photography, and learning about local and exotic flora in a peaceful setting.

places.name: Beco do Batman
places.description: A famous alley featuring vibrant street art and graffiti. The area showcases urban creativity and attracts artists, photographers, and tourists seeking a colorful, dynamic, and visually stimulating experience.

places.name: Pinacoteca do Estado de São Paulo
places.address: Praça da Luz, 2 - Centro, São Paulo
places.description: Renowned art museum housing Brazilian art from the 19th century to contemporary works. Its collection, architecture, and gardens provide an immersive cultural and artistic experience for all visitors.

places.name: Avenida Paulista
places.description: Iconic avenue in São Paulo featuring cultural centers, shops, and skyscrapers. On Sundays, traffic closes for pedestrians, allowing street performances, markets, and public gatherings, creating a lively city experience.
